name: absrpcld

stmt.origin: syl2anc(w0, wcel(cfv(cabs, c0), crp), wcel(c0, cc), wne(c0, nat0))
stmt.pretty: syl2anc(w0, (abs ` c0)∈ ℝ+, c0 ∈ ℂ, c0 ≠ 0)

body.origin:
|- wi(w0, wcel(cfv(cabs, c0), crp))
-| wi(w0, wcel(c0, cc))
-| wi(w0, wne(c0, nat0))
-| wi(wa(wcel(c0, cc), wne(c0, nat0)), wcel(cfv(cabs, c0), crp))

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(w0, wcel(cfv(cabs, c0), crp))
-| wi(w0, wcel(c0, cc))
-| wi(w0, wne(c0, nat0))
-| wi(wa(wcel(c0, cc), wne(c0, nat0)), wcel(cfv(cabs, c0), crp))

body.origin: |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, cc), wne(c0, nat0)), wcel(cfv(cabs, c0), crp))

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(w0, wcel(cfv(cabs, c0), crp))
-| wi(w0, wcel(c0, cc))
-| wi(w0, wne(c0, nat0))

comment: The absolute value of a nonzero number is a positive real. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 29-May-2016.)
